description: The Trump administration plans to end deportation protections for more than 8,000 migrants from Afghanistan, many of whom arrived after the chaotic US withdrawal from the country.
title: Trump to Scrap Deportation Protections for Afghans, Cameroonians

description: Ukraine could be partitioned like Berlin after the Second World War, Donald Trump's envoy to Kyiv has suggested as Russia continues to hold out on accepting a truce.
title: US Envoy Suggests Ukraine Can Be Partitioned 'Like Berlin Post-Second World War'

description: The front-runner in Poland’s presidential election Rafal Trzaskowski accused his main rival Karol Nawrocki of spreading Russian propaganda and “anti-German phobias” in a televised debate that failed to deliver a clear winner.
title: Polish Presidential Candidates Spar Over Security, EU in Debate

description: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth kept his distance — physically and rhetorically — on Friday from a meeting of nations providing military support to Ukraine.
title: Hegseth Keeps Distance From Predecessor’s Ukraine Support Group

description: Argentina eliminated most currency controls and allowed the peso to float within established bands as President Javier Milei’s government said it secured a large disbursement from the International Monetary Fund this year.
title: Argentina Eases FX Rules With $15 Billion From IMF in 2025

description: Italy’s credit rating was upgraded by S&P Global Ratings — the third such plaudit from credit assessors anticipating improvements in the country’s public finances.
title: Italy Wins S&P’s Credit Rating Upgrade in Another Win for Meloni

description: Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro overhauled the central bank’s board after it resisted a plan to include uncertified gold in the nation’s international reserves.
title: Maduro Overhauls Venezuela’s Central Bank Following Gold Dispute

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Every Friday, White House correspondent Akayla Gardner delivers a roundup of the key news and events in politics, policy and economics that you need to know.  Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Tariff Whiplash Underscores Shifting Power Centers in White House

description: Alina Habba, the top federal prosecutor in New Jersey, is investigating state Governor Phil Murphy for allegedly setting a statewide policy to limit cooperation with President Donald Trump’s crackdown on undocumented immigrants.
title: US Attorney Alina Habba Targets NJ Governor Over Immigration

description: JENA, La. (AP) — Columbia University graduate student Mahmoud Khalil can be kicked out of the U.S. as a national security risk, an immigration judge in Louisiana found Friday during a hearing over the legality of deporting the activist who participated in pro-Palestinian demonstrations.
title: Columbia University Activist Can Be Deported, Immigration Judge Says

description: Mercosur countries have decided to relax common external tariffs on 50 products of the choice of each of its members, giving them more flexibility to negotiate deals as they seek to avoid Donald Trump’s tariffs, or retaliate against them.
title: Mercosur to Expand Common Tariff Exemptions as Trade War Rages

description: President Donald Trump’s trade tariffs have hammered financial markets, prompted an outcry from world leaders, and raised the specter of a US recession. He declared a 90-day pause on some of the most punishing tariffs on April 9. Even so, his statement, in which he announced an increase in the tariffs on imports from China, underscored that he’s calling the shots, though the US Constitution gave Congress the last word in setting import duties.
title: Trump Is Using Emergency Law to Impose Tariffs. Is That Legal?

description: US President Donald Trump has made extending the tax cuts introduced by the 2017 Tax Cuts and Jobs Act a top priority this year. On April 10, after weeks of negotiations, Republicans in Congress agreed on the framework of a bill to make them permanent.
title: Will Republicans Hike Tax on Millionaires to Extend Trump’s Tax Cuts?

description: Portuguese Prime Minister Luis Montenegro reaffirmed a pledge to cut taxes and increase wages as he tries to attract voters ahead of next month’s election.
title: Portugal Premier Vows to Cut Taxes, Increase Wages If Reelected

description: Canadian technology leaders are calling for a “real debate” about the country’s economic future when party leaders discuss their views on stage next week.
title: Canada Tech CEOs Urge ‘Real Debate’ on Economy Ahead of Vote

description: Former Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro was hospitalized on Friday after complaining of strong abdominal pains, causing the right-wing leader to interrupt his participation in a political rally.
title: Former Brazilian President Bolsonaro Is Hospitalized With Abdominal Pains

description: President Donald Trump announced new agreements with five leading law firms to provide free legal work to his administration, shortly after saying he would look to use outside lawyers to help negotiate coming trade deals.
title: Trump Cuts Pro Bono Deals With Law Firms as He Seeks Trade Help

description: The Energy Department’s $400 billion green bank and clean energy funding office are set to be among the hardest hit in a second round of voluntary employee buyouts as part of Elon Musk’s effort to cull the size of the federal government, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Musk Buyouts Poised to Hit US’s $400 Billion Green Energy Bank

description: President Donald Trump has floated talks with his Chinese counterpart more than half a dozen times since the trade war started. But prospects look remote, even as their tariff fight appears to have peaked.
title: Trump-Xi Truce Appears Elusive as China Prepares to Dig In

description: France’s finance minister, Eric Lombard, said that targeting US tech firms is just one element of a possible response to Donald Trump’s tariffs that is not yet decided.
title: France Says Tech Is One Possible Part of US Tariff Response

description: Mexico’s President Claudia Sheinbaum said her country would deliver more water to Texas as part of a border agreement but that supplies had been limited by several years of drought.
title: Mexico to Reach Deal on US Border Water Dispute, Sheinbaum Says

description: The European Union is racing to clinch trade deals with countries around the world in an effort to diversify away from an increasingly protectionist US as officials worry that the transatlantic relationship has been irreversibly damaged.
title: EU Races to Expand €2 Trillion Trade Network as US Links Sour

description: A federal judge chided the Trump administration for trying to delay its response to a US Supreme Court order to take steps to return a Maryland man wrongly deported to a notorious prison in his native El Salvador.
title: Trump Officials Chided Over Delay Bid in Deportation Case

description: Lithuania is preparing the legal framework for national sanctions on Russia should the European Union fail to extend its own restrictions later this year due to a Hungarian veto.
title: Lithuania Mulls Own Sanctions on Russia If EU Extension Fails

description: Donald Trump’s “Liberation Day” tariff announcement set off the most volatile stretch of his second term, with financial markets descending into chaos, China unleashing retaliatory measures and the US president pausing some levies only hours after they took effect.
title: American Consumers Are Getting Rattled by Trump’s Tariff Chaos

description: The escalating tariff fight between the US and China is casting a shadow over one of the world’s biggest pending deals, and traders are growing fearful that the takeover will get bogged down by Beijing’s antitrust regulators.
title: Trade War Raises Alarm for Ansys-Synopsys Deal Needing China Nod

description: For investors and economists who made it through the years-long Brexit saga, the UK’s latest GDP release may seem familiar: a sudden jolt in growth, factories racing to boost production, and all while international trading relationships remain up in the air.
title: Brexit Holds an Ominous Lesson for Labour’s Surprise GDP Surge

description: At least several hundred Chinese nationals are fighting with Russia’s army in Ukraine, President Volodymyr Zelenskiy told a gathering of allies as he called for more air defense for Kyiv and more military pressure on Russia.
title: Zelenskiy Says Hundreds of Chinese Men Have Joined Russia’s War

description: President Donald Trump urged Congress to make Daylight Saving Time permanent on Friday, calling the unpopular twice-yearly clock changes “a very costly event.”
title: Trump Begs ‘No More Changing of the Clocks’ in Daylight Time Bid

description: On the night of April 8, as US stocks reeled and Treasuries were selling off, a group of senators put it to President Donald Trump plainly: the market was in freefall because of his tariffs and he needed to lower the temperature.
title: Ted Cruz Says Senators Urged Trump to Stem Market ‘Freefall’

description: Conservative Party grandee Michael Gove was nominated to the UK House of Lords by former Prime Minister Rishi Sunak, who also rewarded six other former Tory cabinet ministers and officials.
title: Michael Gove Joins Harper, Hart on Sunak’s House of Lords Nominations List

description: BNP Paribas slashed its economic growth for South Africa because of domestic political uncertainty and US President Donald Trump’s tariff war.
title: BNP Slashes South Africa Growth Forecast on Politics, Tariff War

description: Massachusetts is one of only a handful of states that prohibits restaurants from offering happy hour drink specials to lure in customers. State Senator Julian Cyr is on a mission to change that.
title: Happy Hour Might Be Coming Back to Massachusetts

description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The commander of a U.S. Space Force base in Greenland has been fired after she sent a base-wide email breaking with official messaging following Vice President JD Vance’s visit to the Danish territory that President Donald Trump is seeking to annex.
title: Head of US Space Force Base in Greenland Fired After Vance Visit

description: President Donald Trump is ramping up pressure on Russia in his bid to secure a ceasefire over its war in Ukraine.
title: Trump Says ‘Russia Has to Get Moving’ in Ceasefire Push

description: BlackRock Inc. Chief Executive Officer Larry Fink said he was caught by surprise at the breadth of President Donald Trump’s tariffs last week on many countries, including key US trading partners.
title: Larry Fink Says Trump Tariffs Went Way Beyond His Imagination

description: European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde told the region’s finance ministers to let Brussels take the lead on trade discussions with the US, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Lagarde Tells Finance Chiefs to Let EU Take Lead on Trade Talks

description: The US extradited a man long-sought by India for his alleged role in the 2008 Mumbai attacks as the two countries work together to combat the “global scourge of terrorism,” Secretary of State Marco Rubio said.
title: US Extradites Alleged Mumbai Attack Plotter to India, Rubio Says

description: Web pages for the ESG advisory practice and institute at the elite law firm, which agreed to a deal with the president, are now dark.
title: Paul Weiss, Assailed by Trump, Quietly Scrubs ESG From Website

description: India can reach a provisional trade agreement with the Donald Trump administration in 90 days if the offers are mutually beneficial, according to a senior official, boosting hopes that the South Asian nation can emerge relatively unscathed from Washington’s tariff strategy.
title: India Explores Interim US Trade Deal Within 90 Days

description: Europe’s top banks have convened a task force to boost the industry’s capacity to support a step change in the region’s defense spending.
title: European Banks Start Task Force to Boost Defense Investment

description: Ukraine has established diplomatic relations with Somalia as Kyiv continues efforts to expand relations with African nations.
title: Ukraine And Somalia Establish Ties as Kyiv Seeks Africa Partners

description: With Noboa and González in a dead heat, the concerns of those that backed the third-place candidate will be key to deciding Sunday’s presidential runoff.
title: Ecuador’s Election Hinges on Indigenous Voters Torn Between Security, Economy

description: US President Donald Trump’s assault on trade is a chance for euro-region governments to give Europe’s common currency stronger weight in global commerce, according to German Finance Minister Joerg Kukies.
title: German Finance Chief Sees Chance for Stronger Euro Role in Trade

description: President Christine Lagarde reaffirmed the European Central Bank’s commitment to intervention in favor of stability.
title: ECB Is Ready to Use Instruments It Has If Needed, Lagarde Says

description: Czech parliamentary leaders called on the US Congress to preserve Radio Free Europe/Radio Liberty outlet as a way to promote free speech and democratic values in authoritarian nations.
title: Czech Leaders Urge US Congress to Keep Funding Radio Free Europe

description: President Donald Trump is casting his latest tariff plan as a strategic win. Markets and business leaders only see more chaos ahead.
title: Trump’s Tariff Shift Still Has Markets, Industry Groups Panicked

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: US and Iran Revive High-Stakes Nuclear Talks

description: The annual physical for the US president is often a humdrum affair to reassure Americans about the health of their commander-in-chief. But those occasions have rarely been routine with Donald Trump.
title: Trump Heads to Physical, Putting Focus on 78-Year-Old’s Health

description: European Central Bank Governing Council member Francois Villeroy de Galhau warned the bloc must not follow the US on financial deregulation and should instead focus on simplifying its rules to be competitive.
title: EU Mustn’t Follow Trump on Regulation, ECB’s Villeroy Says

description: Istanbul’s jailed mayor, Ekrem Imamoglu, is due to appear in court in multiple cases separate to his arrest last month, increasing the pressure on the opposition figure seen as the main challenger to Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan.
title: Erdogan’s Jailed Rival in Court Over Separate Graft Allegations

description: The Kremlin said US special envoy Steve Witkoff arrived in Russia on Friday, though it declined to confirm that he’ll meet with President Vladimir Putin.
title: Kremlin Says Trump Aide Witkoff Arrived in Russia, Tass Reports

description: India’s trade teams are “really charged up” and want to swiftly seal a bilateral deal with the US, a minister from Narendra Modi’s government said, as the South Asian nation scrambles to shield itself from Washington’s on-again, off-again tariff strategy.
title: India Wants a US Trade Deal With an ‘Urgency’ Not Seen Before

description: Europe’s decision to ramp up defense spending after years of neglect is the right choice, according to European Union finance ministers.
title: Europe Finance Chiefs Embrace Defense Spending Ramp Up

description: The tariff pause wasn't enough.
title: Lots More on Why Neil Dutta Is Sticking With His Recession Call

description: On Wednesday, President Trump put a 90-day pause on reciprocal tariffs for every country except China. The market, which had been in a state of deep panic, surged massively on the announcement. But then on Thursday, stocks sold off hard again as people woke up to the reality of massive tariffs on China and the new baseline tariffs on everyone else. Plus, even before all this tariff drama, there were plenty of reasons to be anxious about the US economy. On this episode of Lots More, we speak with
title: Lots More: Neil Dutta Sticking With His Recession Call (Podcast)

description: Europe should “quickly adapt to any regulatory rollback” to protect the competitiveness of its banking sector, French Finance Minister Eric Lombard said as the gulf between the European Union and its key rivals grows.
title: France Calls on Europe to Quickly Adapt to Regulatory Rollback

description: Portugal’s Socialists, the biggest opposition party, led Prime Minister Luis Montenegro’s AD coalition by a margin of 1.4 percentage point in an opinion poll, Jornal de Negocios reported on its website.
title: Portugal’s Opposition Socialists Lead in Poll, Negocios Reports

description: Indonesia is looking to help develop Turkey’s Kaan fighter jet and submarines, underscoring an intent to broaden modernization of Southeast Asia’s largest military to partners beyond traditional defense allies.
title: Indonesia Seeks Role in Turkey’s Fighter Jet, Submarine Projects

description: The US will help bolster the Philippines’ arsenal and step up joint military exercises, Manila’s defense chief said, as tensions between Washington and China escalate.
title: US to Bolster Philippine Arsenal to Deter China, Teodoro Says

description: The European Union will use the 90-day pause in US tariffs to find an alternative solution with President Donald Trump, according to the head of the Eurogroup.
title: EU Will Make Most of 90-Day US Tariff Pause, Donohoe Says

description: US President Donald Trump will probably reach tariff deals soon with countries around the world, Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban said, as he sought to play down the longer-term effects of the trade war.
title: Tariff War to Turn Into ‘Tariff Peace’ Soon, Orban Says

description: Mexico wants a greater proportion of each auto built in the country to qualify for US origin status, a move that would lower the impact of President Donald Trump’s tariff policies, Deputy Economy Minister for Foreign Trade Luis Rosendo Gutierrez said.
title: Mexico Aims to Raise Auto Tariff Exemptions, Trade Official Says

description: Former Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte’s allies ranked higher in a survey on preferred senatorial candidates for the May midterm elections conducted after the ex-leader’s arrest last month.
title: Duterte Allies Get Boost in Philippines Senatorial Poll After His Arrest

description: Support for South Korea’s presidential race frontrunner Lee Jae-myung has risen to a three-month high as he extends his lead over conservative candidates, in a sign the opposition Democratic Party could grab power in nationwide polls on June 3.
title: South Koreans’ Support for Liberal Lee Rises Ahead of Election

description: Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez said his country will work to build “solid and balanced” relations between China and the European Union, as their ties come under strain from an intensifying trade war started by Donald Trump.
title: Spanish Premier Begins Outreach to China, Calls It Partner of EU

description: Financed using a European post-Covid recovery fund, a new rail link could be an economic boost, and a sign that the EU is getting better at spending money.
title: Italy’s €25 Billion Rail Plan Is a Model for EU Spending

description: Shale producers reversed the US oil deficit. Now they face ruin at $50-a-barrel.
title: $50-a-Barrel Oil Is a Problem for US Trade Deficit

description: President Xi Jinping will visit three Southeast Asian countries next week, as China steps up efforts to court partners to buffer the economy against an escalating trade war with the US.
title: Xi to Visit Southeast Asia as Trump Escalates Tariff War

description: US Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth has directed the termination of $5.1 billion in contracts for “ancillary things like consulting and other nonessential services,” as part of his partnership with Elon Musk’s government efficiency task force.
title: Hegseth Plans to Cut $5 Billion in Contracts After DOGE Review

description: For US President Donald Trump, there would be few bigger victories than having a domestically produced version of the iPhone, one of the most popular tech products in history. Such a prize would validate his tariff plan and campaign promise to bring manufacturing jobs back to America.
title: Why Trump’s Dream of Made-in-the-USA iPhones Isn’t Going to Happen

description: Vietnam’s deputy prime minister held high-level talks in Washington with Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent and Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick as the nation pushes for a trade deal amid a 90-day pause in Donald Trump’s reciprocal tariffs.
title: Vietnam Deputy PM Meets Bessent, Lutnick to Push Trade Deal

description: Japan’s Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba said the government has set up a taskforce to respond to the various impacts from the US tariffs, as reports suggested the ruling parties may be considering a sales tax cut to relieve some of the impact on consumers.
title: Japan Sets Up Taskforce to Respond to Tariff Impacts

description: President Donald Trump signed legislation to block an Internal Revenue Service rule that would have forced some cryptocurrency brokers to provide tax information on transactions conducted on their platforms, delivering another victory to the digital asset industry he has vowed to champion in office.
title: Trump Signs Bill Blocking IRS Crypto Tax Rule Biden Pushed

description: President Donald Trump threatened fresh tariffs and possibly sanctions on Mexico, escalating a dispute about water at the US southern border.
title: Trump Threatens Additional Tariffs on Mexico Over Water Rights

description: Top European Union officials are making plans to visit China for a meeting with President Xi Jinping , the South China Morning Post reports — a sign Brussels may be keen to develop better ties with Beijing amid the Trump administration’s tariff onslaught.
title: Xi Set to Host EU Leaders in July, South China Morning Post Says
